full_product_name.product_name: gnome-settings-daemon-0:3.32.0-9.el8_2.1 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream EUS (v. 8.2)

branch.name: Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream EUS (v. 8.2)

full_product_name.product_name: Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream EUS (v. 8.2)

notes.note: gnome-settings-daemon: Red Hat Customer Portal password logged and passed as command line argument when user registers through GNOME control center

reference.description: bz#1873093: CVE-2020-14391 gnome-settings-daemon: Red Hat Customer Portal password logged and passed as command line argument when user registers through GNOME control center

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

note:
An update for gnome-settings-daemon is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Extended Update Support.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The gnome-settings-daemon packages contain a daemon to share settings from GNOME to other applications. It also handles global key bindings, as well as a number of desktop-wide settings.
Security Fix(es):
* gnome-settings-daemon: Red Hat Customer Portal password logged and passed as command line argument when user registers through GNOME control center (CVE-2020-14391)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
